command_hook.description:
Pre/post command lists to run around the main operation. Each command runs from the repository root.
Available variables that cmds can use: https://github.com/Pandoriux/zephyr-release/blob/main/docs/export-variables.md

custom_string_patterns.description: Custom string patterns to use in templates. The key is the pattern, available as '{{ <key> }}' while the resolved value is the key value.

initial_version.description:
Initial SemVer version applied when no existing version is found.
Default: "0.1.0"

path.description: Path to the version file, relative to the project root.

format.description:
Defines the file format. Allowed values: "auto", "json", "jsonc", "json5", "yaml", "toml", "txt".
Default: "auto"

extractor.description:
Defines how to extract the version from the parsed file.
Default: "auto"

selector.description: Defines how to locate the version field, depends on `extractor`.

primary.description: Marks this file as the primary source of truth for the current version.

section.description: Changelog section heading for this commit type. When not provided, `type` value is used.

hidden.description:
Exclude this commit type from changelog generation (does not affect version bump calculation).
Default: false

stop_resolving_commit_at.description:
Defines the boundary for resolving Git commit history. Can be a number or a string.
- Number: The maximum amount of commits to resolve (e.g., 50).
- String: The specific Git commit hash to stop at.

types.description: Commit types that count toward version bumping, must be picked from the base `commit_types` list.

count_breaking_as.description:
Count a breaking change as none / one commit / one bump directly regardless of current chosen `types`, as long as the commit type exists in base `commit_types` list.
Default: "none"

commits_per_bump.description:
Number of commits required for additional version bump after the first. Use Infinity to always bump once, even if breaking changes are counted as bumps.
Default: Infinity

enabled.description:
Enable/disable handling of SemVer extensions (pre-release identifiers / build metadata).
Default: false

treat_override_as_significant.description:
If set to `true`, the presence of an `override` is strictly treated as a structural change.
This immediately triggers resets on any dependent version components (e.g., resetting the Build number)
If `false`, overrides are treated as volatile/dynamic and ignored by reset logic.
Default: false

type.description:
Specifies the type of pre-release/build identifier/metadata.
"static": A stable label that should not change often. Examples: "alpha", "beta", "rc".
"dynamic": A label value that often changes per build or commit, usually sourced externally (e.g., git hash, branch name).
"incremental": Integer value that auto-increments by 1.
"timestamp": Integer value that changes over time, representing a specific point in time since January 1, 1970 (UTC).
"date": A date string that changes over time.

bump_minor_for_major_pre_stable.description:
Redirects major version bumps to minor in pre-1.0 (0.x.3).
Default: true

bump_patch_for_minor_pre_stable.description:
Redirects minor version bumps to patch in pre-1.0 (0.2.x).
Default: false

bump_strategy.description: Configuration options to calculate the next version number.

write_to_file.description:
Enable/disable writing changelog to file. When disabled, changelogs are still generated for pull requests, releases and string templates.
Default: true

path.description:
Path to the file where the generated changelog will be written to, relative to the project root.
Default: "CHANGELOG.md"

file_header_template.description:
String template for changelog file header, using with string patterns like {{ version }}. Placed above any changelog content. Allowed patterns to use are: all fixed and dynamic string patterns. Default: "# Changelog
"

file_header_template_path.description: Path to text file containing changelog file header. Overrides `file_header_template` when both are provided.

file_footer_template.description:
String template for changelog file footer, using with string patterns like {{ version }}. Placed below any changelog content.
Allowed patterns to use are: all fixed and dynamic string patterns.

file_footer_template_path.description: Path to text file containing changelog file footer. Overrides `file_footer_template` when both are provided.

release_header_template.default:
## {{ tagName | md_link_compare_tag_from_current_to_latest }} (
    {{- YYYY }}-{{ MM }}-{{ DD }}) <!-- timezone: {{ timeZone }} -->
release_header_template.description:
String template for header of a changelog release, using with string patterns like {{ version }}.
Allowed patterns to use are: all fixed and dynamic string patterns.
Default: "## {{ tagName | md_link_compare_tag_from_current_to_latest }} (\n    {{- YYYY }}-{{ MM }}-{{ DD }}) <!-- timezone: {{ timeZone }} -->"

release_header_template_path.description: Path to text file containing changelog release header. Overrides `release_header_template` when both are provided.

release_section_entry_template.default:
- {% if scope %}**{{ scope }}:** {% endif %}{{ desc }} [{{ hash | slice: 0, 7 }}](
  {{- host }}/{{ namespace }}/{{ repository }}/{{ commitPathPart }}/{{ hash }})
release_section_entry_template.description:
String template for each entries in the changelog release sections, using with fixed base and version string patterns. Allowed patterns to use are: all fixed and dynamic string patterns.
Additionally, you can use a special set of dynamic patterns which are:
{{ hash }}, {{ type }}, {{ scope }}, {{ desc }}, {{ body }}, {{ footer }}, {{ isBreaking }}.
About special patterns: https://github.com/Pandoriux/zephyr-release/blob/main/docs/config-options.md#changelog--release-section-entry-template-optional
Default: "- {% if scope %}**{{ scope }}:** {% endif %}{{ desc }} [{{ hash | slice: 0, 7 }}](\n  {{- host }}/{{ namespace }}/{{ repository }}/{{ commitPathPart }}/{{ hash }})"

release_section_entry_template_path.description: Path to text file containing changelog release section entry template. Overrides `release_section_entry_template` when both are provided.

release_breaking_section_heading.description: Heading of a changelog release BREAKING section.

release_breaking_section_entry_template.description:
Basically the same as `release_section_entry_template`, but for breaking changes specifically. If not provided, falls back to `release_section_entry_template`.
Allowed patterns to use are: all fixed and dynamic string patterns.

release_breaking_section_entry_template_.description: Path to text file containing changelog release breaking section entry template. Overrides `release_breaking_section_entry_template` when both are provided.

release_footer_template.description:
String template for footer of a changelog release, using with string patterns.
Allowed patterns to use are: all fixed and dynamic string patterns.

release_footer_template_path.description: Path to text file containing changelog release footer. Overrides `release_footer_template` when both are provided.

release_body_override.description: User-provided changelog release body, available in string templates as {{ changelogReleaseBody }}. If set, completely ignores the built-in generation and uses this value as the content. Should only be set dynamically, not in static config.

release_body_override_path.description: Path to text file containing changelog release body override, will take precedence over `release_body_override`.

changelog.description: Configuration specific to changelogs. All generated changelog content are available in string templates as {{ changelogRelease }} (release header + body) or {{ changelogReleaseHeader }} and {{ changelogReleaseBody }}.

String template for branch name that Zephyr Release uses.
Allowed patterns to use are: fixed base string patterns.
Default: "release/zephyr-release"

color.description:
The hexadecimal color code for the label, in standard format with the leading #.
Default: "#ededed"

label.description: Core label used by Zephyr Release to track pull requests, managed exclusively by the tool. These label should not be manually added or removed.

additional_label.description: Additional labels to attach to pull requests, managed and supplied by you. Unlike the core label, these labels are not automatically created if missing.

title_template.description:
String template for pull request title, using with string patterns like {{ version }}.
Allowed patterns to use are: all fixed and dynamic string patterns.
Default: "chore: release v{{ version }}"

Pre/post command lists to run around the release operation. Each command runs from the repository root.
Available variables that cmds can use: https://github.com/Pandoriux/zephyr-release/blob/main/docs/export-variables.md

tag_name_template.description:
String template for tag name, using with string patterns like {{ version }}. Available in string templates as {{ tagName }}.
Allowed patterns to use are: fixed base and fixed version string patterns and dynamic patterns.
Default: "v{{ version }}"

tag_type.description:
The type of Git tag to create, either annotated or lightweight. If annotated, a tag message is required.
Default: "annotated"

tag_message_template.description:
String template for the Git annotated tag message.
Allowed patterns to use are: all fixed and dynamic string patterns.
Default: "Release {{ version }}"

tag_message_template_path.description: Path to text file containing Git annotated tag message template. Overrides `tag_message_template` when both are provided.

name.description: The name of the tag creator.

email.description: The email of the tag creator.

date.description:
Override the Git tag timestamp.
Can be one of these options:
- 'current_time': The moment the operation creates the tag.
- 'commit_date': The Git committer date.
- 'author_date': The Git author date.
Or a specific ISO 8601 date string.
If omitted, defaults to the platform native behavior (recommended).

tagger.description: Custom identity and timestamp information for the Git tag. If omitted, defaults to the platform native behavior.

skip_release_note.description:
If enabled, only the tag will be created, no release note will be made.
Default: false

prerelease.description:
If enabled, the release will be marked as prerelease.
Default: false

draft.description:
If enabled, the release will be created as draft.
Default: false

set_latest.description:
If enabled, the release will be set as the latest release.
Default: true

title_template.description:
String template for release title, using with string patterns like {{ tagName }}.
Allowed patterns to use are: all fixed and dynamic string patterns.
Default: "{{ tagName }}"

title_template_path.description: Path to text file containing release title template. Overrides `title_template` when both are provided.

body_template.description:
String template for release body, using with string patterns like {{ changelogRelease }}.
Allowed patterns to use are: all fixed and dynamic string patterns.
Default: "{{ changelogRelease }}"

body_template_path.description: Path to text file containing release body template. Overrides `body_template` when both are provided.
